content.text:
<image 1>relate to the two long parallel wires shown. Initially the wires are a distance d apart and each has a current i directed into the page.The direction of the force on the right-hand wire due to the current in the left-hand wire is 

A. to the right
B. to the left
C. upward in the plane of the page
D. downward in the plane of the page

To determine the direction of the force on the right-hand wire due to the current in the left-hand wire, we can use the right-hand rule for magnetic forces between currents.

1. **Identify the direction of the currents**: Both currents are directed into the page.
2. **Apply the right-hand rule**: Point your right thumb in the direction of the current in the left-hand wire (into the page). Curl your fingers in the direction of the magnetic field produced by this current. The magnetic field will be circulating counterclockwise around the left wire when viewed from above.
3. **Determine the force on the right-hand wire**: Place your right hand so that your fingers point in the direction of the magnetic field at the location of the right-hand wire. Your thumb will then point in the direction of the force on the right-hand wire due to the magnetic field of the left-hand wire.

Since both currents are in the same direction, the magnetic fields they produce will cause an attractive force between the wires. Therefore, the force on the right-hand wire due to the current in the left-hand wire will be towards the left.

The correct answer is:
B. to the left
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
